org.osmdroid.bonuspack.routing
Class Road

java.lang.Object
  org.osmdroid.bonuspack.routing.Road

public class Road
extends java.lang.Object

describes the way to go from a position to an other. Normally returned by a call to a Directions API (from MapQuest, GoogleMaps, OSRM or other)

Author:
M.Kergall
See Also:
MapQuestRoadManager, GoogleRoadManager, OSRMRoadManager

Field Detail

mStatus

public int mStatus
STATUS_OK = road properly retrieved and built. STATUS_INVALID = road has not been built yet () STATUS_TECHNICAL_ISSUE = technical issue, no answer from the service provider. All other values: functional errors/issues, depending on the service provider.

mLength

public double mLength
length of the whole route in km.

mDuration

public double mDuration
duration of the whole trip in sec.

Parameters:

Returns:

getLengthDurationText

public java.lang.String getLengthDurationText(int leg)
Parameters:
leg - leg index, starting from 0. -1 for the whole road
Returns:
length and duration of the whole road, or of a leg of the road, as a String, in a readable format.

buildLegs

public void buildLegs(java.util.ArrayList<org.osmdroid.util.GeoPoint> waypoints)
As MapQuest and OSRM doesn't provide legs information, we have to rebuild it, using the waypoints and the road nodes.
Note that MapQuest legs fit well with waypoints, as there is a "dedicated" node for each waypoint. But OSRM legs are not precise, as there is no node "dedicated" to waypoints.

public int describeContents()
